授業目的: <Lecture> The purpose of the Lecture course is for students to improve their understanding of the SDGs, lecture structure in English, lecture listening skills and vocabulary. <Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> The purpose of this course is to help students develop their academic discussion and research skills. Students will use input from the lecture, readings and their own research to discuss SDG-related topics. Students will develop discussion skills from EC5.＜Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing＞In this course, students will improve on their writing and research skills. We will especially focus on finding sources, summarizing/quoting, and critically evaluating sources. Students will finish the semester by completing research and writing of a problem-solution style essay.＜Special Topics> Special Topics courses are a chance for students to choose and study a topic through English. Each EC6 Special Topics course is different. The topics are determined by the teacher. Please check "Notice from undergraduate/graduate schools" for more information about each course.
到達目標: <Lecture> Students will improve: English lecture listening skills, reading and research skills, note-taking, vocabulary, and presentation knowledge and skills. <Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> Students will be able to discuss and present about SDG-related topics from a problem-solution perspective, hold extended discussions on a topic, and use discussion strategies.<Lecture Bridge Research and Writing> Students will be able to summarize SDG-related articles, conduct independent research and incorporate that into their knowledge on a topic, critically evaluate input, improve on essay writing skills and language.<Special Topics> Students will be able to review and practice EC skills while developing topic-specific knowledge and vocabulary.
特記事項: 【合併】English Communication VI　Ａ（総合政策学部）/英語コミュニケーションVI　Ａ（総合政策学部）
授業方法: Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English. Course materials will be available to students through LUNA.

トピック.授業計画1:
*All 14 classes will be conducted face-to-face.
<Lecture> Each topic will be introduced on a four-week cycle following a problem - solution genre. The first week, will introduce an SDG, providing background information and important definitions. The second week will address the causes of the problem and the interrelatedness of the topic with other SDGs. The third and fourth weeks will introduce solutions to the problem and discuss the successes and limitations. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion>Materials and topics will follow the lecture course while also introducing discussion skills and improving vocabulary knowledge. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing> The majority of the course will be spent researching, summarizing and writing an academic problem-solution essay. The schedule for each Special Topics course will depend on the teacher and will be announced to students at the beginning of the class.
トピック.授業外学習2:
<Lecture> Students will read and complete preparation worksheets for each lecture. Students will need to review materials throughout the semester. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Discussion> To prepare for the discussions, students will read articles, attend the lectures, and research the topic on the Internet In the discussions, they present, discuss, and explore the topics based on the lecture, reading, and research. 
<Lecture Bridge Reading and Writing> Students write a problem-solution essay as well as read articles and prepare for in-class tests. 
<Special Topics> Each Special Topics course will have different homework associated with the topic.
